snippet: Support for the rape suspect — a mullah — and plans by the girl’s family for an “honor killing” have become emblematic of a broader failure to help female Afghan victims.
abstract: Case of Afghan girl who accused mullah of raping her in mosque has become emblematic of broader failure to help Afghan women who have been victims of violence; girl was removed from women's shelter that had given her refuge, and women's activists are worried that her family will carry out an 'honor killing' against her.

byline.contributor: Habib Zahori contributed reporting from Kunduz, and Jawad Sukhanyar from Kabul, Afghanistan.

lead_paragraph: Support for the rape suspect — a mullah — and plans by the girl’s family for an “honor killing” have become emblematic of a broader failure to help female Afghan victims.

headline.main: Struggling to Keep Afghan Girl Safe After a Mullah Is Accused of Rape
headline.print_headline: Struggling to Keep Afghan Girl Safe After a Mullah Is Accused of Rape
